comments.author: j luke Hypernova

comments.text:
Isn't this a paradox? if Marty tells Doc the lightning is going to strike 
at 10:04 precise, Doc is able to tell the papers the exact time it happened 
(because he was there recording these 'weather experiments'.) But he knew 
he had to be there...

Flyer (memorial) => Marty tells Doc => Doc tells the papers what happened 
=> Flyer (made from news records) => ...

This hurts my brain.﻿

made with Eric Stoltz as Marty, rather than Fox, after the film-makers were 
initially unsuccessful in getting access to Fox because of his commitment

hold of him eventually — you just could not imagine anyone else playing 
that role once you have seen the film.

comments.text:
1955/11/12 22：04 時計台に落雷
デロリアンの動力源はプルトニウム。でもここでは入手不能。
1.2ジゴワットの電流はこの時代では稲妻くらいしかない。
そこで思いついたのがこの作戦だった。
時計台に落ちた雷を利用してその電流を次元転移装置に送り込めばいいと。だが倒れた木が繋いでいたケーブルを外してしまい大変！急いで繋ぎ直す博士。
デロリアンは８８マイルに加速。
22：04、時計台に雷が落ち、ケーブルを伝って次元転移装置に流れてマーティは1985年に帰った。

comments.author: Luis TAJES

comments.text:
One thing that I feel needs pointed out is how extraordinary the structure 
of this climax is, in that it's just following two characters for several 
minutes without any exchange of dialogue. Technically, the goings-on of the 
scene is incredibly minimal - in the world of the movie, not much is 
happening. The same kind of goes for films like Jaws and Halloween - just a 
couple of characters in a relatively confined area trying to solve a 
single, direct problem. And yet, the tension is unbearable and the payoff 
is spectacular. It's really a technique that isn't heavily utilized anymore 
in the bigger-scale films made nowadays, and it goes to show that when it 
comes to good storytelling, character development wins out over effects 
work every single time.﻿
comments.author: FishbowlPhenom

comments.author: Rebecca Leddington

comments.text:
When I visited New Balance for the fourth time in about a month to finally 
buy a pair of shoes, Yordanos, the assistant manager, sounded pleased about 
the reply to her e-mail I sent her closer to the beginning of the month. 
She said they posted my e-mail in the lunchroom and some of the other 
associates got a good laugh out of it.

It made me a bit proud, so here is her e-mail and my reply:

Hello Tim,
 
I am emailing you to let you know that we have received the MT810BR2 in 
size 12D.

I will put them on hold for you under your name until March.11th  so you 
can come try them on.

If you have any questions  or if you need more time to try them on, let us 
know by giving us a call at: 604 685 2281.
 
Thank you,
 
Yordanos Gulbot
Assistant Manager
New Balance Vancouver
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Great Scott!

Did you mean April 11th? Otherwise I'll have to go back in time to March 
11th, 2014 and l've just used up the last of my plutonium, not to mention 
the flux capacitor in my DeLorean is on the blink and that infernal 
contraption almost failed me on Saturday, November 12th, 1955 when I tried 
to get the 1.21 Gigawatts from a bolt of lightning.

So, are these shoes compatible with the hoverboard I pre-ordered for 2015? 
Or will Nike's power laces be the only future-proof product coming out?

Please excuse the crudity of my humour. I didn't have time to custom build 
or polish it.

See you in the future,

Tim Holloway

PS: Back to the Future (10/10) Movie CLIP - Back to the Future (1985) HD

#backtothefuture   #bttf   #funny   #humor   #humour   #greatscott  ﻿

comments.text:
interesting details: when the delorean is powered by either mr fusion or 
plutonium you can see sparks gathering in front of the delorean, forming a 
portal that the car eventually pierces when it hits 88 mph. this is the 
only escene in the movies where the sparks are absent, because the car is 
lacking the nuclear reaction to open the portal, now if you slow the escene 
where the delorean gets hit by the lighting, you can see that the lighting 
made his way from the cable, trough the delorean to the front of the car, 
and exploded into the portal directly wich the delorean then entered﻿

comments.text:
This movie is great. But the ending is confusing as hell. Marty restored 
his existence. But it's still a different timeline because of the way his 
family becomes. Yes, the event where he travels back in time is restored. 
But when the other him travels back in time, he has different memories than 
Marty because Marty changed the way his family would become. So when Marty 
goes back, he wouldn't have that picture of him and his siblings because 
they're different and- my head is going to explode.﻿

comments.author: Paul Bauman

comments.text:
ok, guys, the scene isn't perfect according to the laws of physics! But 
you'll have to agree with me that that doesn't matter! First and foremost a 
movie is entertainment, and it certainly delivers on that! I can think of 
numeral ways why this scene wouldn't work in real life but who cares? It's 
movie magic and i was on the edge of my seat the first time i saw this and 
still am! it's a perfectly executed moment in film that's actually shown in 
class on the movie academy on how to do a scene right! chapeau for robert 
zemeckis﻿
